page.title: 05WICKHAMBROOK AND FARLEY GN
page.content: Wickhambrook is a large village of scattered hamlets around small greens. There are eleven of these Greens. Only the southern part of the village is within this area, and two of the Greens: FARLEY GREEN and part of ATTLETON GREEN . FARLEY GREEN has only two or three farms and half a dozen houses including a former bakery and two modern bungalows. It is a truly peaceful rural area - one former farm, SILVER LEY, was written about in a book of that name by ADRIAN BELL. (One of a series of books on farm life in Suffolk in the 1920s). Peacocks Farm (16th cent) has a typical thatched Suffolk farmhouse. A thriving clay- pigeon club meets here and barn dances are held sometimes - in the barn ! For ATTLETON GREEN see next page.
